2018.title: Zeek (formerly Bro)
2018.description: In 2018, the open‑source network security monitor Bro was officially renamed to Zeek. Zeek is a powerful, flexible platform that provides deep traffic inspection, high‑fidelity log generation, and rich analysis—widely used in networks and national labs.

2018.title: ThingPot
2018.description: ThingPot, released in July 2018, is one of the first interactive honeypots designed specifically for IoT platforms. It simulates devices and their protocols to track and analyze real-world IoT attack behavior.

2018.title: Falco
2018.description: Falco, a CNCF project, gained major momentum around 2018 as a cloud‑native runtime security engine. It monitors system calls and behaviors in containers and hosts to detect anomalous activity in real time.

2018.title: Wazuh
2018.description: Although Wazuh originated earlier, by 2018 it had matured into a robust open‑source security platform integrating HIDS, log analysis, file‑integrity monitoring, and SIEM capabilities across diverse environments.
